main event: On November 6, 1957, in New Cambria, Missouri, there was a ground visual observation of a large, round, opaque object traveling very slow and heading south for a duration of 10 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as very large and traveling at a very slow speed without any visible tail, trail, or exhaust, and without making any sound.
It was reported to be at a height of 15,000 feet and remained in sight for the entire 10-minute duration
The object was observed to be round and invisible, with a slow rotation of 2 to 2.5 revolutions per minute.
No maneuvers were observed, and it was heading due south.
There were no comments of preliminary analysis from the 79th Acron Duty Director.
sighted object: large, round, opaque object traveling very slow
